fields.description:
After migrating from Mantis (using the migration tool) we have noticed that in almost all cases JIRA has removed all hash '#' characters from description fields, along with the meaning that comment once held.

This may also be the case for other special characters where content is imported into a "Wiki Style Renderer" field. 
As these are not special characters in the bug system they came from, they should be left as plain text.

We did not notice this change for some months after a migration (and after heavy use of JIRA), so we now have no choice but to maintain our old bug tracking system for cases such as this.
fields.summary: Missing '#' characters post migration (from Mantis)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35188].
  {panel}

Enabling the Stash Integration, you end up with two tabs in the JIRA issue: Source and Commits. But the commits can't be disabled, if you try do disable the DVCS plugin (that is now a System Plugin), the Commits tab will disappear, however, you will also loose the ability to create Branches from JIRA.

*Steps to reproduce:*

- Integrate JIRA with Stash.
- The issues will have two tabs: Commits and Source. All your Stash related information is in the Source tab.
- Try to remove the Commits by disabling the System Plugin _JIRA DVCS Connector Plugin_.
- Then you miss the Create Branch as well.

*Expected bevahiour:*

The commits tab should not be shown if the only integration is with Stash and there are not DVCS accounts using the Commits tab.
fields.summary: Stash integration break when trying to remove Commits tab

Hey guys,

We are moving JIRA from OnDemand to Standalone instance ... and it looks like there is no link to "JIRA User Server" under "Administration
/User management" any longer ... meaning I cannot create an app to access JIRA users from outside (i.e. from Confluence).

I am logged as sysadmin and this account belongs to 'system-administrators' group.

Here are options available:
!options.png!

*WORKAROUND:*
Navigating directly to http://<local-installation>/secure/admin/ConfigureCrowdServer.jspa will reveal the screen for setting up externally-acessible user management.

To re-enable this, please back up your data, run the following query, and restart JIRA:

{code:sql}UPDATE pluginstate SET pluginenabled='true' WHERE pluginkey='jira.webfragments.admin:crowdApplication';{code}

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35164].
  {panel}

10/03/2013 at 01:10 Added comment to the issue MYPROJECT-22
10/03/2013 at 02:12 Added comment to the issue MYPROJECT-22

Then I use {code}/rest/api/2/search
Jql =(project = MYPROJECT AND updated >= "2013-10-03 02:11")
fields = labels,created,updated,status{code}

And I do not get any issues

Then I try another query 
{code}/rest/api/2/search
Jql =(project = MYPROJECT AND updated >= "2013-10-03 01:09")
fields = labels,created,updated,status{code}

And I see that the date "updated" was not changed
{code}
...
[key:protected] => MYPROJECT-22
[fields:protected] => Array
    (
        ...
        [Updated] => 2013-10-03T01:10:10.000-0700
        [Created] => 2013-10-02T05:18:18.000-0700
        ... 
    )
...
{code}
But if you try to get information about this issue directly
{code}/rest/api/2/issue/MYPROJECT-22{code}
You can see that updated date was changed
{code}
Array
( 
[key] => MYPROJECT-22
[fields] => Array
    (
    ...
    [created] => 2013-10-02T05:18:18.643-0700
    [updated] => 2013-10-03T02:12:28.963-0700
    ...
    )
)
{code}
Seems that "updated" date of an issue chages when was added or edited comment of this issue, but doesn't change when comment was deleted from it.

Is this a bug?
If not, how can I get over /rest/api/2/search all the issues were comments were delted since a certain date?

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

* Set -Duser.timezone=EST or -Duser.timezone=America/New_York as a JVM input argument in setenv.bat file.
* Create an issue and set the due date to 3/Oct/13 for instance.
* View this issue in the issue view, issue navigator and the database.

*Expected Result*
* The due date shows the correct value consistently wherever the issue is viewed and is stored in the database jiraissue table as 2013-10-03 00:00:00

*Actual Result*
* *In the Issue View:*: The due date shows correctly as 3/Oct/13
* *In the Issue Navigator:* Under the due column, the date for this issue is 2/Oct/2013
* *In the database:* The due date for this issue is recorded as 2013-10-02 23:00:00

*Some Notes*
* It appears that the problem may be related to daylight saving time, so I'm not sure if it's reproducible all year round. 
* Because 'due date' is a date field and not datetime, it is expected that the time in the database entry should have 00:00:00 for time, however because the time is one hour off it is recorded as {actualDueDate -1day 23:00:00} in the database. Which eventually translates into a whole day difference when read from the database back into a date field. 
* Invariably, the more troubling issue is the inconsistency with the date that so far was noticed only with due date field and not other date fields like Created, Updated, Commented etc.

*Workaround*
Removing the timezone JVM argument -Duser.timezone= eradicates the problem somehow, this should be ok if the JIRA Server is set to the same time zone. JIRA can be configured to use the default system time.
fields.summary: Issue due date is off by one hour in the database, and inconsistent arround JIRA interface when time zone is set using -Duser.timezone=EST or -Duser.timezone=America/New_York JVM input argument

fields.description:
{panel:title=Scenario 1 for JIRA 6.x|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#f7d6c1|bgColor=#ffffce}
h3. Summary

JIRA Advanced Search does not display the custom field options if the custom field context is configured for specific issue types (and not as *Global (all issues)*) or projects.
 !no_action.JPG|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom field (e.g. Multi-select or Select List) and associate it to the bug issue type. For example:
 !field_context.JPG|thumbnail!
 # Re-index the instance.
 # In Advanced search: try to type the following JQL query
{code:java}
issuetype = bug AND Teams = 
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Get the list of available values for the *Teams* field.
h3. Actual Results

The values are not displayed, even if all issue types are selected (using multiple selection) in the Custom Field Context.
h3. Notes
 * This problem does not happen on Basic Search
 * If multiple contexts were configured and there are contexts not associated with any specific issue types (i.e. *Global (all issues)*), then the Advanced Search will display the options from those contexts.{panel}
{panel:title=Scenario 2 for JIRA 7.x|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#f7d6c1|bgColor=#ffffce}
h3. Summary

Problems:
 # JIRA issue navigator *basic search* does not autocomplete correct custom fields value for all projects.
 # Problem #1 can be negated by using explicit JQL from advance search. But, an invalid warning message seen after toggling to *basic search* when a specific custom field value which is outside of global context is selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

For problem #1:
 # Create custom field and specific a context for certain projects.
 !field_context.JPG|thumbnail!
 # Go to issue navigator's basic search, and add the custom field to the search options.
 # Use the following search criteria
{code:java}
Project = All
CF Test = test4
{code}

For problem #2:
 # Select advanced searching and use the JQL:
{code:java}
CF Test = test4
{code}

 # Toggle to basic search.

h3. Expected Results

For problem #1:
The value "test4" is a valid search option and should be displayed by autocomplete because the criteria of "Projects = all" would include projects with the context created.

For problem #2:
No warning message
h3. Actual Results

For problem #1:
The value "test4" does not appear.

For problem #2:
Error message is seen.
 !JQL_Search_Basic.PNG|thumbnail! 
{panel}
fields.summary: Autocomplete does not work when custom field context is restricted to issue types or projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35125].
  {panel}

*Background*
Global JIRA administrators delegate parts of the daily work to the project leads/project administrators such as managing project roles. Especially in larger enterprise instances with hundreds of projects managing project roles seems to be a common task for project administrators.

*Current behaviour*
Now if an user tries to open an issue he/she does not have the permission to view he/she gets an permission violation screen. On this permission violation screen the only contacts currently named are the "JIRA administrators". 

*Improvement* 
But if project role administration is mostly done by project administrators, it would be helpful to show the name/s of the project lead/project administrators for the current project on the permission violation screen as well. Users could than directly contact the project lead and in most cases would get faster access to the project/issue than by contacting global JIRA administrators.
As not every installation of JIRA would like to have this feature, e.g. public mode instances, showing the project leads/project administrators on the permission violation screen should be optional. This could be a global option or a per-project option. An additional option could be to show just the plain name or an e-mail link.
fields.summary: Option for showing project lead/project administrators on permission violation screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JIRA uses a Proxy Server to communicate with HTTP and/or HTTPS Servers, you can define the following Authentication arguments:
{{-Dhttp.proxyUser=atlaspirate -Dhttp.proxyPassword=yarrrrr -Dhttps.proxyUser=atlaspirate -Dhttps.proxyPassword=yarrrrr}}

These Arguments supply credentials to authenticate against a Proxy Server so that requests can be made.

This configuration is defined in: [How to Configure an Outbound HTTP and HTTPS Proxy for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Configure+an+Outbound+HTTP+and+HTTPS+Proxy+for+JIRA]

JIRA Webhooks do not appear to respect these configuration settings.

h3. Environment
- JIRA using WebHooks

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a HTTP Web Proxy that Requires Authentication
# Create a Simple WebHook that communicates over HTTP that needs to communicate with a Proxy Server due to: [JRA-43143|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43143]

h3. Expected Results
# JIRA should be able to authenticate consistently with Proxies. This would include WebHooks.
# Webhooks should pass authentication of a Proxy server if the credentials of the proxy server are correct.

h3. Actual Results

The following error has been seen in the logs:
{code}
2013-10-01 20:07:38,263 webhooks-http-retriever:thread-7 ERROR      [webhooks.util.http.CachingHttpContentRetriever] Unable to post to http://XXX.XX.XX.XXX:8080 due to HTTP/1.0 407 Proxy Authentication Required
{code}

h3. Workaround
At this stage, the only known workaround is to configure the Proxy Server to allow non-authenticated requests. You may be able to limit the incoming connections by network address, or through another method.
fields.summary: Webhooks do not work with HTTP proxies that require auth

fields.description:
Precondition: Clear cookies and cashe in your browser.
STR:
1. Browse Jira as logged in user (use your own account)
2. Proceed to Tempo
3. Click on right and / or left arrows (to list days to see reported hours for activities)
ACT:
Pop up with "The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down." error message appears for a second and disappears. 
Please see attached screenshot: problem.png
EXP:
Jira pages are opened without any notification messages about server down-time or glitches.
NOTE:
This issue is reproducible if you open Jira page with daily reported hours for the first time only. Issue is not reproducible if you open page for the second time. 
Pop up with error message disappears in a second and Jira works as usually.

I make Tempo issue: https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/JTMPO-976
Tempo team write next comment:

Please contact Atlassian about this as it is not within our scope. It could be useful for them to get some information about the system you are using.
Susanne Götz
Tempo team
fields.summary: Jira. Not expected pop up about Jira glitch and impossibility to reach the server

fields.description:
We have a customfield plugin which uses JavaScript generated by view template. And we faced with the problem which affects IE8 only. We have such problems while running JIRA 6.1-rc1, JIRA 6.1-rc2 and JIRA 6.1. But on JIRA 6.1-m5 everything works well.


{code:title=atlassian-plugin.xml|borderStyle=solid}
<customfield-type key="fieldKey" class="com.fieldKey">
...
<resource type="velocity" name="view" location="templates/view.vm"/>
<resource type="velocity" name="edit" location="templates/edit.vm"/>
...
</customfield-type>
{code}

{code:title=view.vm|borderStyle=solid}
<script type="text/javascript"></script>
{code}

Environment:
JIRA 6.1-rc1 or JIRA 6.1-rc2 or v6.1#6144-sha1:2e50328,
IE8

Scenario:
* install plugin with above configuration
* create the customfield  and put it to Default Screen
* create an issue
* navigate to view issue screen of the issue
* start inline-editing on any customfield in details-module
* submit editing
* see that details-module is gone
fields.summary: Javascript tag in view template makes details-module to disappear after submitting inline-editing in IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35111].
  {panel}

Is there a reason why field is not trimming trailing white space in custom and system field?

Like if someone enter a new version in a project by copy pasting it. 
It will sometime put a trailing white space with it. 

If you then try to access this information through REST or SOAP, you might have difficulity doing so since you won't enter a white space, and if you do so it may be trimmed. 

Would there be a way so that either an option or an automatism to always trim system and custom field of trailing white space?

Thanks

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Time Since Chart that has been added in Confluence as External Gadget does not shows the chart. In the contrary, it works fine in JIRA.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Add [Time Since Chart|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Time+Since+Issues+Gadget] in JIRA dashboard. Make sure that it works fine. 
# Copy the Gadget Specification URL of the Time Since Chart in JIRA and add it into {{Confluence Admin >> External Gadgets}}
# Create a new page in Confluence and add the macro from the macro browser. 

h4. Diagnosis
* This behavior only affects Time Since Chart macro from JIRA 6.0.8. The macro from JIRA 6.0.4 works fine. 
* Tested on Confluence 5.1.4 and 5.2.3.

h4. Screenshot
!time-since.png!
fields.summary: Time Since Chart macro is faulty in Confluence

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
* Create a project with and set only 'Reporter' in the 'Browse Project' permission for the project.

*Expected Behavior*
* Atleast, only users who have the 'create issue' permission for the project and/or have already created issues in the project should be able to see it.

*Actual Behavior*
* All logged-in users are actually able to see the project, including users who don't have create issue permissions and are not potentially reporters.
* They are however not able to see any issues in the project.
* Removing 'Reporter' from the 'Browse Project' permission, removes any unauthorised access to the project again.

*Other notes:*
* This bug seems to match the exact same behavior as reported for the 'Current Reporter' permission in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34389. However, I have created a seperate bug for it because this [documentation clearly states|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Current+Reporter+Browse+Project+Permission] that the 'reporter' permission is different from the 'current reporter' permission. If this is a mistake, I guess the ticket can be closed as such.
* The obvious workaround ofcourse is not to use 'Reporter' at all in the 'Browse Project Permissions', but the problem with this is that some use-cases need to allow any body who has created an issue in a project to be able to browse the project and atleast access issues they have reported.
fields.summary: Granting the 'Browse Project' permissions to 'Reporter' causes the project to be seen by all users

fields.description:
The new JIRA Mobile interface deployed with JIRA 6.0 includes a "Give Feedback" button that cannot be disabled, as far as I can tell.  I've looked through the modules of the JIRA Mobile plugin as well as those of the JIRA Feedback plugin, and there does not appear to be a way to disable this button.

The "Give Feedback" button directs the user to send an e-mail to Atlassian, which is completely inappropriate for standalone JIRA systems.  System administrators should not have to explain to users that they should not use a menu option provided so prominently by the tool.  However, that is the position we are left in with JIRA 6.0 (it's either this or disable the JIRA mobile interface altogether).

Please provide a way to (at minimum) disable this feedback button, or (ideally) allow the feedback address to be customized.
fields.summary: Cannot disable "Give Feedback" button on JIRA Mobile interface

fields.description:
Hi,
If I choose projects from the Administration menu, I get straight to the page without authenticating. For other items on the Admin menu I have to do second authentication with my password first.
This seems odd.

I can edit project details at this point without Admin mode being enabled.

Then, if I try to add a project I get the second authentication request. I type in my password and Jira then takes a good 15 seconds to take me to a URL :
https://jira.surevine.net/secure/admin/WebSudoAuthenticate.jspa
Which is a blank page.

I can then click "Back" and I find I am logged out.
If I authenticate from here, I go back to the projects screen in user mode.
If I authenticate to admin mode from one of the other menu choices (e.g. User Management) first, then go to projects, things work OK.

I think this is related to JRA-34646
fields.summary: Admin Projects, cannot authenticate

fields.description:
Any export made after a plugin upgrade without a restart of Jira will contain the old versions of the custom fields provided by the plugin, even if the plugin upgrade was minor and had nothing to to with custom fields.

This is a bigger problem because you will end-up with backups/exports that you cannot import due to version mismatch.

This can be easily reproduced with JIRA Agile or Script Runner plugins.
fields.summary: Exports made after a plugin upgrade contains old versions of the custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35086].
  {panel}

According to the [Global Permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions] article:
{quote}
Permission to log in to JIRA.
(warning)  The number of users that count towards your JIRA license is the sum of all users (including users in groups) that 
{quote}

Upon the description, we understand that JIRA license is calculate based on the JIRA User permission. However, this is my finding below in JIRA 6.x vanilla instance:
* The user under *JIRA Users* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license.
* The user under *JIRA Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license (without *JIRA Users*).
* The user under *JIRA System Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license (without *JIRA Users* or *JIRA Administrators*).
* The users under *JIRA Users*, *JIRA Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license.
* The users under *JIRA Users*, *JIRA Administrators*, *JIRA System Administrators* and has *Active* condition will be count towards JIRA license.

In *summary*, if the user have any groups in Global Permission with *Active* condition, the user definitely count toward JIRA license and also able logged in JIRA. For example, comparing this two article:
* [JIRA Global Permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions]
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Get+a+List+of+Active+Users+Counting+Towards+the+JIRA+License

The article could mislead our users in future about how user counts toward JIRA license.
fields.summary: Misleading documentation of managing user license
